newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Asian Metals - S.Korean demand remains depressed.
newsitem.headline: Asian Metals - S.Korean demand remains depressed.

text.p: South Korean base metals demand remains depressed on a combination of financial woes at companies such as Kia and the Jinro group, low seasonal summer demand and high world prices, dealers said on Thursday.

"There has been no spot aluminium business since three-month prices broke the $1,600 a tonne level and this has combined with the financial troubles of several big domestic groups," a dealer at a major trading house said.
He said domestic buyers were asking for aluminium at lower than current market prices and they were locked in a stand-off with sellers.
Local dealers widely expect international aluminium prices to rise further next week.
Aluminium import premiums for spot delivery fell to between $90-$95 a tonne CIF Pusan over LME cash prices from $95-$100 a week ago, traders said.
Domestic aluminium prices rose to 1,560,000 won a tonne from 1,540,000 won a week earlier in line with recent gains on the LME, they said.
Copper and zinc prices were unchanged at 2,553,000 won and 1,386,000 won a tonne respectively from the previous week.
"We don't know the current import premiums for copper spot delivery since there have been no purchases for spot delivery from overseas but only exports," one copper trader said.
Domestic lead prices were also flat at 678,000 won a tonne over the past week.
Several Korean traders said some Chinese zinc smelters are facing delivery problems due to the low quality of their zinc products.
"We heard that the quality problems would cost the Chinese, an additional $100 a tonne to meet London Metal Exchange (LME) standards," a trader with a brokerage firm said.
The trader said the quality problems had forced the Chinese smelters to borrow their existing loss-bearing short positions for the first quarter of next year.
He said the Chinese seem to have also rolled over their nearby positions to earn more time to prepare physical delivery against their shorts.
